ABS(n) - Numeric function.description: Returns the absolute value of a numeric expression (floating point only).

ASC(x) - Numerical Function.description: Returns the ASCII code of the first character in a string. Throws ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY ERROR if string is empty.

ATN(n) - Numeric function.description: Returns the arc tangent (inverse of TAN) of a numeric value, result in radians. Throws ?TYPE MISMATCH, ?OVERFLOW, or ?SYNTAX ERROR on invalid input.

CHR$(n) - String function.description: Converts a number (0–255) to an ASCII character string. Inverse of ASC. Throws ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY, ?TYPE MISMATCH, or ?SYNTAX ERROR on invalid input.

CLOSE(n) - Command.description: Close an open file/device (0–255); flushes buffer to disk/tape; errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY if out of range.

COS(n) - Numeric function.description: Returns cosine of angle in radians; errors: ?TYPE MISMATCH (non-numeric), ?OVERFLOW (out of range), ?SYNTAX (missing/extra arguments).

DIM Array - Single dimension.description: Declare a new array with one dimension. Add additional arrays manually if needed.

EXP(n) - Numeric function.description: Numeric function EXP(X) evaluates e raised to the power of the given number.

GOSUB <label>, Command, Basic v2 & BPP+.description: Insert GOSUB statement with a label placeholder

GOTO <label>, Command, Basic v2 & BPP+.description: Insert GOTO statement with a label placeholder

LEFT$(s,n) - String function.description: Returns the leftmost n characters of a string. Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY (0–255), ?TYPE MISMATCH (wrong type), ?SYNTAX (missing args).

LEN(s) - Numeric function.description: Returns the number of characters in a string (0–255). Errors: ?TYPE MISMATCH (non-string), ?STRING TOO LONG (over 255), ?SYNTAX (missing or extra arguments).

LOG(n) - Numeric function.description: Natural logarithm of a numeric value. Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY (≤0), ?OVERFLOW (too large), ?SYNTAX (missing argument).

MID$(s,start[,length]) - String function.description: Returns a substring starting at 'start' position with optional 'length'. Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY (0–255), ?TYPE MISMATCH (wrong type), ?SYNTAX (missing args).

POKE(addr,byte) - Command.description: Sets the contents of memory at the given address (0–65535) to a byte value (0–255). Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY if either value is out of range. Caution: Incorrect usage may corrupt memory or lock the system.

PEEK(addr) - Integer function.description: Returns the contents of memory at the given address (0–65535). Result is 0–255. Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY if address is out of range.

REM [text] - Comment, BASIC v2.description: Insert a REM comment. Everything after REM on the line is ignored by the interpreter.

RIGHT$(s,n) - String function.description: Returns the rightmost n characters of a string. Errors: ?ILLEGAL QUANTITY (0–255), ?TYPE MISMATCH (wrong type), ?SYNTAX (missing args).

SGN(n) - Numeric function.description: Returns -1 for negative numbers, 0 for zero, 1 for positive numbers; errors: ?TYPE MISMATCH (non-numeric), ?OVERFLOW (out of range), ?SYNTAX (missing argument).
